Member Function Documentation

void SQLiteDatabase::error ( int  iReturnCode,
const std::string &  strMessage 
)

Error handling function.

Throws a SQLiteException pointer. The error code and Message will be combined into the SQLiteException message.

Parameters:
iReturnCode - The error code from SQLite.
strMessage - The error message.

void SQLiteDatabase::execute ( const std::string &  strSQL,
bool  bError = true,
bool  abortOnErr = true 
)

Executes a SQL statement.

Does not return any data.

Parameters:
strSQL - The SQL statement to execute.
bError - Set to true to trap SQL statement errors, or false to ignore.
abortOnErr - true calls Err::abort on SQLite exception, else just throw the exception.
